text: The time rate of increase in velocity is called
Which of the following quantities is a vector?
In an elastic collision, momentum is conserved as well as well as?
explanation: An elastic collision is an encounter (collision) between two bodies in which the total kinetic energy of the two bodies remains the same.

text: The induced current in a coil always flows in a direction so as to oppose the change that causes it. This statement is known as
Which of the following instruments can be used to compare the magnitudes of charges on two given bodies?
A body of mass 2 kg is released from a point 100 m above the ground. Calculate its kinetic energy 80m  from the point of release.
explanation:
K.E = mgh
but h = 80m, m = 2kg, g = 10m/s^2
K.E = 2 x 10 x 80 = 1600J.

text: Which of the following waves is not mechanical?
A loaded spring is set in simple harmonic motion. The force that tends to restore the load to its equilibrium position is
explanation: Elastic Force: This is the force exerted by the spring when it is compressed or stretched. It is the elastic force that directly acts to restore the spring to its equilibrium position.

text: Which of the following cases cannot produce total internal reflection? A light ray travelling from
The vacuum in a thermoflask reduces heat loss resulting from
explanation:
The vacuum of a thermos flask prevents heat loss by conduction and convection, conduction because vacuum is a poor conductor of heat, convention because
the space between the walls is a vacuum which reduces the heat loss due to conduction and convection. if there is any atmospheric air or material between then there will be some amount of heat transfer through the conduction and convection

text: The diagram above represents an experimental set-up for verifying?
explanation: the diagram above is an experimental set up for verifying lens formula

text: Which of the following statements about a moving object is correct?

options.A: When accelerating, the resultant force acting on it must be equal to zero.
options.B: There must always be a non-zero resultant force acting on it.
options.C: At a steady velocity, the resultant force acting on it must be equal to zero
options.D: At a steady velocity, the air resistance must be equal to zero.

text: If the efficiency of a transformer is 100%, which of the following equations would be correct?

options.A: the molecular magnets remain randomly arranged.
options.B: the molecular magnets are properly aligned
options.C: it is affected by the earth's magnetic field
options.D: the magnetic domains are within the earth's field

text: Which of the following graphs above of a charge Q against potential difference V across the capacitor is correct?
explanation: C = \(\frac{\text{Q}}{\text{V}}\) ⇒ Q = CV which means that Q Is directly proportional to V.

text: A small amount of air is introduced into the vacuum above the mercury in a mercury barometer tube. The mercury level goes down because the air molecules

options.A: heat the mercury and make it expand
options.B: increase the pressure above the mercury.
options.C: cool the mercury and make it contract.
options.D: decrease the pressure above the mercury

text: Calculate the quantity of heat needed to change the temperature of 60g of ice at 0 °C to 80 °C. [specific latent heat of fusion of ice= 3.36 x 10\(^5\) Jkg\(^{-1}\) specific heat capacity of water 4.2 x 10\(^3\) J kg\(^{-1}\) K\(^{-1}\)]
The wire of a platinum resistance thermometer has d resistance of 3.5\(\Omega\) at 0 °C and 10.52\(\Omega\) at 100°C. Calculate the temperature of the wire when its resistance is 7.5\(\Omega\).
A transverse pulse of frequency 9 Hz traves 4.5m in 0.6 s. Calculate the wavelength of the pulse.
In which of the following media is the speed of sound the least?

Which of the following characteristics of waves can a ripple tank be used to demonstrate?
I. Reflection
II. Refraction
III. Diffraction
explanation:
ripple tank experiment can be used to demonstrate the following properties of waves:
ReflectionRefraction
Diffraction

text: Which of the following graphs gives the correct relationship between energy and mass when mass is converted to energy.
An 800 kg car moving at 80 km hr\(^{-1}\) collides with a 1200 kg car moving at 40 km hr\(^{-1}\) in the same direction. If the cars stick together, calculate their common velocity.
The mass of a load is doubled while the force acting on it is halved. The resulting acceleration of the load is
explanation:
Force = mass x acceleration
but force was halved = 1/2 and mass doubled = 2 ( assuming that force and mass are 1N and 1kg respectively)
f = ma = \(\frac{1}{2}\) = 2 x a
dividing both sides by 2
a = \(\frac{1}{2} \times\frac{1}{2} = \frac{1}{4}\)

text: The maximum and minimum thermometer reads the

options.A: the maximum temperature during the day and the minimum temperature at night at all times.
options.B: the maximum temperature at night and minimum temperature during the day at all times
options.D: the maximum temperature during the day and minimum temperature at night from the last reset

text: An a.c. the generator can be converted to a d.c. generator by replacing the
Which of the following statements is the correct reason for using soft iron in making the armature or an electric bell?

options.D: It retains its magnetism for a long time

text: The diagram above illustrates a meter bridge circuit underbalanced conditions. Determine the value of x.
explanation:
Using wheatstone bridge principle;
\(\frac{2}{x} = \frac{2}{(100 - x)}\)
2(100 - x) = 2 x \(x\)
200 = 2\(x + 2x\)
200 = 4x
x = \(\frac{200}{4}\)
= 50cm

text: Which of the following devices is used for storing electric charges?

An electron of mass 9.1 x 10\(^{-31}\) kg moves with a speed of 2.0 x 10\(^6\) ms\(^{-1}\) round the nucleus of an atom in a Circular path of radius 6.1 x 10(^{11}\) m. Determine the angular speed of the electron.
explanation:
Angular speed of the electron (W)
w = \(\frac{Velocity}{Radius} = \frac{V}{R}\)
= \(\frac{2.0 \times 10^6}{6.1 \times 10^{11}}\)
= 3.28 x 10\(^{16}\) rads\(^{-1}\)

text:
An electron of mass 9.1 x 10\(^{-31}\) kg moves with a speed of 2.0 x 10\(^6\) ms\(^{-1}\) round the nucleus of an atom in a Circular path of radius
6.1 x 10\(^{11}\) m. Calculate the centripetal force acting on the electron.
A device consumes 100 W of power when connected to a 120 V source. Calculate its resistance.
Which property of a wave remains constant when the wave travels from one medium into another?
explanation: Frequency remains unchanged as waves travel from one medium to another because it is characterized by the source of the wave.

text: The anomalous expansion of water occurs in the range
A ray of light traveling from a rectangular glass block of refractive index 1.5 into air strikes the block at an angle of incidence of 30. Calculate its angle of refraction.
explanation:
Given that refractive index = 1.5, angle of incidence = 30°, angle of refraction =?
using snell's law = refractive index = \(\frac{sini}{sinr}\)
=\(\frac{1}{n } = \frac{sin30}{sinr}\)
= \(sinr = 1.5\times sin 30\)
r =  \(sin^10.75\)
= 48.6°
this is because ray is traveling from a more denser medium to a less dense medium

text: A rectangular piece of iron measuring 4 cm by 3 cm at 20\(^o\)C is heated until its temperature increases by 100 C. Calculate the new area of the metal. [Linear expansivity of iron is 1.2x 10\(^{-5}\) K\(^{-1}\)]
Two bodies of masses 3.0 kg and 2.0 kg are separated by a distance of 50 cm. Calculate the force of attraction between them. [G = 6.67 x 10\(^{-11}\) Nm\(^2\) kg\(^2\)]
The diagram above illustrates an object moving in a circular path at a constant speed. Which of the arrows indicates the direction of linear velocity?
explanation: for an object moving along a circular path, it speed is constant but its linear velocity changes with time at every point on the circle.

text: Which of the following thermometers is used to measure the temperature of the human body?
explanation: The range of usefulness of the thermometer is set by the boiling point of the liquid used. In the case of the ethanol-filled thermometer, the upper limit for measurement is 78 °C (172.4 °F), which makes it useful for measuring daytime, nighttime and body temperatures, although not for anything much hotter than these.

text: In the diagram above, the time taken to trace a wave between P and Q is?
explanation: frequency means no of oscillation per secs, so the time taken to trace a wave between p and q is 2secs.

text: Which of the following materials does not serve as a safety device in electrical circuits?
Which of the following liquids has the highest surface tension?
explanation: Cold water has a higher surface tension than soapy water, hot water, and oily water. Soapy water has surfactants that reduce surface tension, while hot water has lower surface tension than cold water due to increased molecular motion. Oily water also has a lower surface tension than pure water.

text: The nucleon and proton numbers of a neutral atom of an element are 238 and 92 respectively. Determine the number of neutrons in the atom.
An instrument used to measure relative humidity is the?
explanation:
A hydrometer is an instrument used for measuring the relative density of liquids based on the concept of buoyancy.
A hygrometer measureshumidity, the amount of water vapor in air

text: The area under a velocity-time graph represents
Which of the following statements about a neutral atom is correct? The

options.A: core is composed of electrons and protons
options.B: number of electrons is equal to that of neutron
options.C: number of neutrons is equal to that of protons
options.D: number of protons is equal to that of electrons.

explanation: Atoms are neutral; they contain the same number of protons as electrons.

text: Which of the following properties is not exhibited by sound waves?
explanation: polarization, property of certain electromagnetic radiations(such as radio waves, visible light, and gamma rays) in which the direction and magnitude of the vibrating electric field are related in a specified way

text: When ultraviolet light is incident on certain metallic p articles are emitted. These particles are called
explanation: Photoelectrons are electrons that are ejected from a material (usually a metal) when it absorbs photons of light, such as ultraviolet light. This phenomenon is known as the photoelectric effect.

text: The graph above illustrates the variation of temperature \(\theta\) with time (t) for a solid that is being heated. Which processes take place at segments P and Q respectively?
explanation: Since the substance is solid, it will need heat to melt to liquid and once the liquid starts boiling temperature will remain the same.
